description: Jamie Lee Curtis' daughter Annie brought a whole new meaning to the phrase, 'just like her mother.'
title: Golden Globes red carpet sees Jamie Lee Curtis' daughter Annie sport silver hair
title_page: Golden Globes red carpet sees Jamie Lee Curtis' daughter Annie sport silver hair | Daily Mail Online
text:
With a mother as stylish as hers, Annie Guest didn't need to look far to find inspiration for her Golden Globes look.
The 29-year-old dancer copied Jamie Lee Curtis' silver hair as the two arrived together for the awards ceremony on Sunday.
Curtis, 57, wore her silver barnet short and cropped, while Annie's was a flattering tousled shoulder length
Scroll down for video
A family affair: On Sunday, Jamie Lee Curtis, 57, was joined by daughter Annie Guest, 29, at the 73rd annual Golden Globes in Beverly Hills
Jamie looked ravishing in a navy blue floor-length gown complete with black flower detailing.
The Scream Queens star kept her makeup to a minimum, with a simple nude lip and lined eyes.
Annie was classically dressed in a white floor-length gown, sans a train unlike her mother's.
The dress featured a cinched waist, held together by a sparkling broach.
The light-haired beauty opted for a slightly more dramatic make-up look with winged liner and a pink lip.
See live updates on the Golden Globes 2016 with the latest red carpet pictures and videos
Style twins: Dancer daughter Annie was the star's plus one for the night, looking similar to her mother with her grey-tinted hair
Red-carpet ready: The 29-year-old beauty was classically dressed in a white flloor-length gown, sans a train unlike her mother's
Jamie is nominated for Best Performance by an Actress in a Television Series - Musical or Comedy for her work in Fox's new show, Scream Queens.
She's up against last year's winner, Gina Rodriguez, who made waves for her work in the CW's Jane the Virgin.
Just like Jamie, Gina also brought a family member to the red carpet, her father Genaro Rodriguez.
A nod of her own: Jamie is nominated for Best Actress in a Television Comedy for her work in Fox's new show, Scream Queens
Fierce competition: She's up against last year's winner, Gina Rodriguez, who made waves for her work in the CW's Jane the Virgin
